body:
So I am very addicted to Minecraft. I just can't stop. And I don't know why. My dad says Minecraft is a very useless game (obviously I disagree) and that I should quit playing it altogether. So I kept on trying and trying without success. That was awhile ago.

Now the whole world is playing it with more than 16,000,000 players on PC/MAC playing on single player and on servers (Avicus included) and I still don't really know why it's so popular.

My thereon is that Minecraft is:
  • fun building stuff
  • fun killing stuff
  • fun playing with friends
  • Blowing stuff up
  • DIAMONDS!!!
  • And... Ya

Think you got a reason? Let's see it down below!

Thanks for reading!

replies.body:
Its fantastic for children (or adults) that have learning disabilities like Autism with even communities dedicated for children with these issues. This in itself really says all about the magic and value that can be gained from minecraft. There are even systems in place to get minecraft into schools for teaching purposes! 

It also caters to people who want to play alone, multiplayer, use guns, play minigames, role play, etc etc etc the list goes on and thats all without using mods which are another kettle of fish.

replies.body: Minecraft is a way for me to relax, when I come home from a 12 hour shift at work and just need to relax a bit, I take my coffee and just join Avicus, sometimes I just watch others play but most often I play too. I heard about Avicus and thought I might join just to see if I would find something interesting, I didn't expect I would get to know some amazing people, especially not after all the harassment I'm forced to deal with every day. I don't play single-player, I just play multi-player with other people, it's because of you guys I play. #EmotionalSpeech

replies.body:
I think Minecraft has grown because of the community - it saw how Minecraft could be used to create amazing things, and this is what happens. From servers to texture packs to adventure maps to mods, and even going into servers and a whole convention! Not to mention how Minecraft is easily recordable because it (I think?) is less intensive than most PC games, so many people can record their gameplay and provide entertainment through YouTube, reddit, etc.

So in the end, I guess it was because of how Minecraft was simple and easy to use, but it provided (and sitll does) virtually endless possibilities that anyone and everyone could explore.
replies.body_tagged:

Not to mention how Minecraft is easily recordable because it (I think?) is less intensive than most PC games, so many people can record their gameplay and provide entertainment through YouTube, reddit, etc.

So in the end, I guess it was because of how Minecraft was simple and easy to use, but it provided (and sitll does) virtually endless possibilities that anyone and everyone could explore.
